result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Priscilla Marie Beckerdite

records.addlTxt:
3:33 PM Defendant Priscilla Marie Beckerdite appeared by video.  Attorney Taylor M Hart appeared by video for Priscilla Marie Beckerdite.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
2021CF000130, 2022TR000926, 2022TR000927 & 22CF81 tracking together:
Atty Hart received a new offer on the matters and the matters are resolved; requests a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing date
bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:06 AM Defendant Priscilla Marie Beckerdite appeared by phone.  Attorney Taylor M Hart appeared by video for Priscilla Marie Beckerdite.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
2021CF000130, 2022TR000926, 2022TR000927 & 22CF81 tracking together:
Atty Hart states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Hart waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Priscilla Marie Beckerdite not in court.  Attorney Taylor M Hart in court for Priscilla Marie Beckerdite. 
21CF130, 22CF81
Atty Hart states his client is currently in jail in another county on a cash bond.  Atty Juech requests status.
BY THE COURT:  Set AIA and status.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Priscilla Marie Beckerdite appeared by phone. 
Defendant states she did reach out to her current attorney and just has not heard back from him.  Requests adjournment.  Court questions defendant if anything has changed since he appointed Atty Taylor Hart on her other case.
BY THE COURT:  Court will appoint Atty Taylor Hart and reset this matter.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.  *Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to go on premises where it is sold/served.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Priscilla Marie Beckerdite appeared by video, in custody.  Also appearing is Attorney Will Anderson on behalf of the defendant.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Atty Anderson is not sure if defendant will qualify for PD appointment.  
Atty Juech requests $2500 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Anderson requests signature bond or low cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $2500 cash bond with conditions.  Court also finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.  Set for IA
Initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
